p: Type 2 diabetes was induced by providing a high sucrose diet and the oral administration of dexamethasone (corticosteroid) at a calculated dose of 1.0 mg/Kg for three weeks, as described in previous studies [ 64, 65, 66]. Levels of glucose and insulin were analyzed from the first day to the end of the third week. Food intake, daily water consumption, and animal activity were also recorded on days 7, 14, and 21. The diabetic status of the animals was determined using homeostatic model assessment (HOMA) indices (HOMA-IR, HOMA Î²%, and HOMA sensitivity).
